SEARCH
Package core

Class LayerManager

java.lang.Object
core.LayerManager
public class LayerManager extends Object
LayerManager keeps track of all layers in the editor. It stores the list of layers, handles selecting and moving layers, and manages undo history. Responsibilities of LayerManager: - Add and remove layers - Track which layer is currently selected - Move or resize the selected layer - Allow selecting a layer by clicking on it - Store previous states so the user can undo changes Each layer is stored in order, such that earlier layers appear behind later ones when rendered. The manager does not draw anything, it only maintains data that the Renderer uses.

  • Method Details

    • addLayer

      public void addLayer(Layer layer)
      Adds a new layer to the canvas and records the action for undo.
      Parameters:
      layer - the layer to add

    • removeLayer

      public void removeLayer(int index)
      Removes a layer at the given index and saves the previous state.
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the layer to remove

    • deleteSelectedLayer

      public void deleteSelectedLayer()
      Deletes whichever layer is currently selected. After deletion, no layer is selected.

    • undo

      public void undo()
      Restores the most recent saved state from the undo history. If there is no saved state, nothing happens.

    • getLayers

      public List<Layer> getLayers()

    • getSelectedLayer

      public Layer getSelectedLayer()
      Returns the currently selected layer, or null if no layer is selected.
      Returns:
      returns the layer the position of selected index. If out of bounds or not found, returns null

    • selectLayer

      public void selectLayer(int index)
      Selects a layer by list index. Does nothing if the index is invalid.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the layer to select

    • selectLayerByClick

      public void selectLayerByClick(Point p)
      Selects the topmost layer under the given screen point. Layers are checked from front to back so the visible layer is chosen. If no layer is under the point, the selection is cleared.
      Parameters:
      p - the point where the user clicked

    • moveSelectedLayer

      public void moveSelectedLayer(int dx, int dy)
      Moves the selected layer by the given offset.
      Parameters:
      dx - horizontal movement in pixels
      dy - vertical movement in pixels

    • getHandleAt

      public Layer.HandlePosition getHandleAt(Point p)
      Checks whether the given point lies on any resize handle of the selected layer.
      Parameters:
      p - the location to test
      Returns:
      which handle is being hovered, or NONE if none match

    • setLayers

      public void setLayers(List<Layer> newLayers)
      Replaces all layers with a new list, usually after loading a file. Clears the current selection.
      Parameters:
      newLayers - the new list of layers

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all layers and clears the selection.
